title: HRIS Solution Associate- France
content:
Established in 1981 with a single store in the Northwest of England, the JD Group is a leading omni-channel retailer of Sports Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues and over 3,400 stores across several retail fascias in over 30 markets around the world.
JD Sports Fashion Plc was listed on the London Stock Exchange in 1996 and has been a FTSE100 publicly quoted company since 2019 and continues to grow in the UK and internationally.
We want to be the leading global omnichannel retailer in the sports and outdoor industry. To be a part of this successful company and help us to achieve this you will have the desire to ingrain our strategic goals of being a people-led, innovative and customer-focused organisation which provides operational excellence whilst identifying new areas of growth as part of our day to day objectives.
HRIS Solution Associate- France
Responsible to: EU Solution Manager.
Department: People Operations
Location: France, Lille
Hours: 40 hours
Overview
Advance the People Teams impact by delivering a full HRIS programme within a cluster of European countries aimed at positioning JD as an employer of choice.
The JD People team puts the colleague at the heart of what we do to develop a level of service that emulates the JD brand and maximises colleague experience. We are looking for an ambitious and eager individual to supporting the designing and implementing of complex, high profile HRIS implementations. The role key objective will be to support in implementing overarching global design principles, with essential changes for local territory requirements.
This role is hands-on and candidates must be capable of working to multiple directions in key deadlines.  To support the design of system functions and processes with the ability to configure system infrastructure to deliver requirements alongside the management of multinational teams and other key supporting roles.  The successful candidate will need to be process-driven, highly analytical and organised.
A successful candidate should possess a good track record in a HR/ Workforce or Pay environment and can applying their knowledge of one or more areas of the People function to support the resolution of complex challenges.
Key Roles and Responsibilities:

Help implement the design a systemic solution to best suit the Groups requirements
Support the delivery of the confirguration and Implemention of a HRIS solution across European countries.
Support testing processes and training and communication drafting
Have a passion for providing quality, security and accuracy
Deliver impeccable service to the wider People Team and wider business
Support the design, build and test integrations between HR solution and other product workstreams.
Coordinate your team for the following activities: Compliance, SKU Testing, BAU Changes, Global Design templates and more

Skills

Previous experience in a HR/WFM or Pay field essential
Ability to work under own initiative essential
Previous experience in deploying HRIS solutions across multiple territories beneficial
Ability to work on own initiative as well as part of a team.
Effective communication skills both written and oral
Confident and courteous in dealing with internal and external stakeholders
Prominent level of attention to detail with strong administrative and organisational skills and be able to prioritise your own and your team’s workload
Must be methodical and be able to work to strict deadlines.
Have an awareness of GDPR and be able to act with absolute discretion and confidentiality
Ambitious to learn with an enthusiastic approach
Successful candidate must have valid passport and be able to travel internationally

We know our employees work tirelessly to make JD Sports the success it is today and in turn, we offer them some amazing benefits:

Free parking
Incremental Holiday Allowance
Staff Discount On JD Group and other brands within the organisation
Pension Scheme
Personal development opportunities to learn and develop at work.

Due to the high volumes of applications our opportunities attract, it takes time to review them all. If you don't hear back within two weeks of you applying, please consider your application to have been unsuccessful on this occasion
Applications that meet the skills criteria will be contacted for a 1st stage meeting with the talent team. Shortlisted candidates will then be invited to interview with the hiring manager.
Thank you again for your time.
